intro: Alsine emarginata, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils. The plant has slender, often hairy stems and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Alsine emarginata is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is commonly found in regions such as the southwestern United States and northern Mexico.
